reviews.productTitle: Clapper The Original Home Automation Sound Activated Device, On/Off Light Switch, Clap Detection, As Seen On TV
reviews.text: For 10 years, I joked with my husband that I wanted a clapper. He finally caved and I love it lol even with it's quirks... it takes some practice to get the rhythm and tone of your claps right to work it, but still better than having to get out of bed! Unfortunately, it does register perfectly timed coughs and will turn on/off unexpectedly. It doesn't work for items that have to be turned on/off with buttons like an oscillating fan.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2025
reviews.title: Works for what I need

reviews.productTitle: Clapper The Original Home Automation Sound Activated Device, On/Off Light Switch, Clap Detection, As Seen On TV
reviews.text: Sadly, this is a great concept but it just didn't deliver. PROS: It has two outlets which is a great convenience. CONS: It doesn't take 3 prong plugs. Also, It only worked "okay" up close, with just the right timing between claps, and with a good, loud, clap, but that meant it only turned on and off 1 out of maybe every 3, 4 or 5 claps. It almost NEVER clapped on and right back off again, and when I put it in the location where I needed it (behind a console desk on opposite wall from the door with the only light strip in the room) it almost never clapped on or off unless I opened the door to the desk OR walked into the room and stood in front of it - which defeated the purpose because I had to navigate into a very dark library (with obstacles) to turn it on. Also had the pleasant experience of stinging hands more times than I care to count from trying to clap so hard and clear. I WILL note that my hubby had an easier time getting it to work (large man hands vs. definitely small woman hands?) but I can't sit around & wait for him to get home to turn the lights on and off! Bought remote control plugs instead and am a happy camper.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2025
reviews.title: Not reliable enough for me

reviews.text: It doesn't work... There are two 'sensitivity' settings, but every time I try to use it, no matter the setting, it thinks it's picking up background noise and does not function. Only way I can get it to work (inconsistently) is if I'm right next to it, which completely defeats the purpose. Unfortunately was supposed to be a fun, nostalgic gift... but turned out to be a waste of money. I bought it as a Christmas present but life happened and we didn't actually try it until March, so definitely outside the return window.
